text: Had Indian buffet here and the food was pretty good. They had great service - the waiter was very attentive and always refilled our water when needed and the check came promptly when asked for. Their dessert was some type of flan that tasted a bit like egg custard which was pretty unique to other Indian buffet places ive been to that had rice pudding and other stuff. Would recommend!

Tried Darbar after reading such great reviews. Had a birthday lunch for 4 last week. Let me begin by commenting that the table service was excellent. Everyone was attentive & polite - thank you!The food was ok; I was a bit disappointed because I expected fine dining. We opted out of the buffet as the presentation/choices were not appealing and by 2:30 in the afternoon we weren't sure how long the food had been exposed (the buffet is right by the entrance- everyone that comes in has to pass by the food;some of which is not properly covered).We ordered 3 varieties of bread- Aloo Paratha/potatoes, Cheese Nan, & Nan- The aloo paratha was ok-skimpy on the potato though. The Nans were a little greasy (visible) as was the pastry on the samosasOne person who doesn't care for ginger asked if ginger could be omitted from her order... any selection...the answer was unfortunately not as the spices are pre mixed.  So she ordered Tandori Shrimp. I tasked a shrimp because I noticed her sour facial expression as she ate. I saw why... the spices were overpowering  & salty even for me who loves highly spiced food. But the most disturbing was the fact that the shrimp I tasted had a pungent aftertaste of ammonia which I had experienced before when buying fresh seafood from a well known wholesale place. Not sure if the shrimp were old or it was some kind of preservative. Nevertheless, the waitress was most gracious and canceled the order & replaced it with Chicken 65-spicy deep fried chicken ... except it was covered with sauce! - which was not described on the menu. The chicken was a little dry on the chicken vindaloo even though it was smothered deeply in sauce.All was not lost, the  guest of honor highly enjoyed the Chicken Korma and another enjoyed the Chcken Tikka Masala. The mango and pistachio ice cream was very good.Darbar is ok but I've had much better. It was overpriced for the quality and certainly not  'fine dining' at least in my opinion - sorry.

We ate here at the end of 2017, and have been meaning to write a review about how wonderful the service was.  Can't remember what we had anymore, but the food was definitely excellent Indian.  What stood out was how much the manager / owner cared about our experience, they served us our food after bringing everything out, and plating / environment was overall quite excellent (lovely without feeling overly formal).

Ordered chicken tikka masala and the mixed biryani. The food was absolutely delicious but pricy (that's the only reason I didn't give 5 stars). We got a free naan for checking in and also got free dessert (rice pudding) from the owner which was nice and very delicious!

Wonderful experience with amazing staff that made for a really memorable night. Amazing service that expertly handled our large, rowdy bunch and served up a delicious spread. The chicken kebab appetizer was unbelievable!!! I will dream about that tender, delicious dish until I return again. Thank you for a beautiful evening!

I had been craving Indian food and my daughter found Darbar. Quite the find! The food was delicious and the variety extensive. Our server Simran was great; what superb attentiveness and friendly countenance. I would return in a heartbeat.
Great find!   Delicious. Best mojito on the beach...no kidding. Really good food and great service/people.
The food was super salty, meat on the lamb chops we're raw.The service was not the best.  We we're a group of 9, they brought out food for 7 and forgot about the other 2 orders.

Terrible service. We waited over 50 min for our food and the waitress didn't even ask what we wanted to drink. All the places in NY-don't waste your time here. So many other places to eat without the long wait and terrible service.

This place is very good if you are in the midtown east area! I ordered the chili paneer, beetroot kofta curry, and chicken mirch curry for takeout. It was still fresh when I reached my house and the food was very tasty. Definitely recommend this place to anyone in the area!

My office had an impromtu lunch for 13 people. I called another Indian Restaurant and they were the worst! Not helpful and then after finally getting through to someone, they sent me to voicemail so I moved on to Darbar! Mike the manager was GREAT! He spoke to me from his CAR!! My catering order arrived on time and the food was AMAZING!!! Dar will get out business again!  Thank you Darbar and thanks so much Mike!!

New favorite Indian place. Grew up in the UK so I fancy myself as someone who knows their stuff. I discovered their shrimp vindaloo first, great flavor and spice with a delish garlic naan to sop up the sauce. Good options too for those that don't like the spice at that level, they'll tailor things, nice friendly staff. I have them dial up the heat on the garlic shrimp bhoona but have that as is and enjoy, superb flavor. So happy this place is around the corner from my office. Only issue now is my post lunch food coma!!

Darbar is our favorite Indian restaurant in the city. My husband Richie, daughter Ada and I have been coming here for years because of both the quality of food and excellent service from waiters. Everyone is friendly and welcoming you will not be disappointed in eating at Darbar's. If I could give it more than 5 stars I would.
I love Darbar!  The food is absolutely delicious and the service is the best.  I highly recommend this restaurant.
I have eaten here a few times. This the good is great. This is my goto spot in midtown for Indian food. The price for lunch is decent, the average price. The location is convenient.

One of the best Indian restaurants in NYC. Darbar is conveniently located a short walk from Grand Central. It offers cooked-to-order menu for dinner while buffet style dining for lunch. We have been here a couple of times and the food has been phenomenon for both lunch buffet and a la carte dinner. Very fresh meat and vegetables and generous on spices and seasoning which makes this restaurant really stand out that you don't have to go to Murray Hill for an authentic experience. The weekend lunch buffet is definitely a steal with various meats and vegetable dishes to choose from, fresh oven baked nann are served right out of the oven. I fell in love with their Bindhi Masala AKA okra sautéed with onion in masala sauce  when I had it at lunch buffet and kept ordering it from a la carte. Not many places can get this dish, it so easily gets slimy or not tender but this restaurant really knows how to make this dish perfectly. Even my husband who hates slimy food would enjoy it. Chicken tikka malasa and butter chicken are also fantastic with juicy tandoori oven grilled chicken pieces in rich sauces that is full of spices instead of sugar. We've been fooled so many times at other Indian restaurants in NYC areas that the sauces are too sweet and chefs taking short cuts of throwing uncooked unmarinated chicken breast into tomato soup (I could name quite a few...). This is definitely not the case at Darbar. This restaurant truly lives up to its great reviews and is our go to Indian restaurant near Grand Central.
The chicken Malai was delicious, naan was a lovely mix of fluffy with crispy blistered puffs. It was just filling enough for me, try their 4-course Prix fixe if you have a big appetite

Quite nice Indian place while upscale inside with plenty of room on the upstairs, is also not too crowded and reasonably priced for the Midtown neighborhood.Highlights of my work dinner here include are the house special Lamb Chops and the Rosemary Naan. The other items were quite good, too.

Yay for lunch specials! The lunch buffet offered a variety of meat and curry dishes at varying spice levels, which I appreciated. My favorite were the goat curry and the fish. I loved the naan, which was so fluffy and warm and delicious, and was refilled continuously. The service was very quick and friendly, and the interior was nicely designed. I had a positive experience and would return in the future!
Great food and service / great find on my second city neighborhood. Highly  recommend. Now February and going back second time. Here resturant week and great. With Darbar I order individualy.

Having been to Darbar many times, I was looking forward to another great experience eating here and enjoying a fun night with friends. I love the food and the ambiance was great.We walked in having made a reservation for 7:30 pm. We were seated and given menus. The ambiance hadn't changed and it was still quiet, warm, and a great place to host conversation. We started with three samosas (not on the menu, but they accommodated our request, which was really wonderful of them). They were delicious, as is the food there. I ordered the saag paneer with chickpeas added so chickpeas and paneer in the saag. Partner ordered the chicken tikka masala and our friend ordered the chef special, which looked like a sort of curry, with a check-in naan. The food was presented gorgeously and the waitress told us to let her know if we'd like more rice, implying that it would be free. Only issue is that they also didn't ask us what spice level we'd like and I LOVE spicy, which was a bummer. Again, wow, the food here continues to be some of the best Indian food. However, when our orders came, mine didn't have the chickpeas. I notified the waitress, and she removed the dish and later came out with a fresh one with the additional chickpeas. Together, it was delicious and I was thrilled. I was less than thrilled when a different waitress asked me if we wanted more rice and we said sure, then she said it would 4-5$. I was very confused as I thought that the rice would be free, and that previously and in every other Indian restaurant I had been to, extra rice was free. She later came back when we decided and gave us free rice, but this whole encounter was very confusing and slightly upsetting. We tried to leave by asking for the check, but I think there was miscommunication or our request was lost because we waited for about 20 minutes for our check. This, in combination with my order mishap, and the rice confusion, had marred the experience. The food though, still great.

This is our 5th year hosting a successful networking event at Darbar for about 70 people.  We have done this at both the 46th and 55th Sts locations. The entire restaurant team, especially Mike, work non-stop to make everything work smoothly.  The food is excellent and plentiful and there is ample room for a large group upstairs at 46th St.  Strongly recommended, thank you Darbar and Mike.

We have used Darbar Grill to cater our non-profit org's annual fundraiser for two years now.  Their food is excellent and the guests always rave about how amazing their dishes are.  My personal favorite is the beetroot kofta - it's unique and just full of amazing flavor.  All their dishes are wonderful - their food is perfectly spicy and very flavorful. Working with Mike (Manek-ji), Priti-ji, and his whole team was great.  Mike is a professional that has clearly mastered catering and ensuring his client thinks about all the needs for an event.  His staff is courteous and all wanted to ensure that the event is successful.  The whole team is very easy to work with and are true partners for their clients.  They want to ensure their client gets exactly what they envisioned.  I cannot recommend the Darbar Grill team more!  Thank you for making Chhaya's fundraisers so successful! We couldn't have done it without your support and your delicious food!

This restaurant serves exceptionally great choice of fine Indian cuisine - the food is consistently delicious and the service is wonderful- truly an upscale experience at moderate price.The variety of dishes served are amazingly good at this restaurant - so my wife and I catered the food for our daughter's pre-wedding dinner. We were extremely pleased with the outcome - not only did they manage it very well, but our invited guest from all over the country had nothing but positive compliments and rave reviews -  I recommend definitely try the the vegetable samosas, Reshmi Kabob, Chicken Tikka Masala, Beet Root Kofta, Chicken Mirch Bhuna, Naans - all these dishes are really special. There are other dishes that also stand out and are served picture perfect. Every dish we have tried at this restaurant as usual is fresh with quality ingredients and appropriate balance of spices and seasonings - an art and science perfected to bring the aroma and flavor of Indian cuisine to it's full - these guys certainly have their act together. Check this place out, I am positive you are bound to have an amazing culinary experience. I am  booking them again for another upcoming event, so I can delight my guests ...in the meanwhile, my wife and I will enjoy a few more trips to make our selection for the event!

Food was good, not much else was so only two stars. The obnoxious loud rap/techno music is hard to understand. We asked for it to be turned off or down, but no luck. I had to beg for a drink refill. Service would be one star. I would come back for the food. Making things worse at the end of our meal we noticed one of our glasses was cracked with a jagged piece of glass. Hopefully they improve their service...
So amazing love this food so much!! Everything is DELICIOUS, we got sat right away. The staff was very accommodating. If you're looking for good indian food come here
Excellent lunch buffet. Fresh and good food, good service and reasonable pricing. Clean.

Nice location. A bit pricey, we did the 3 coarse meal for 2 and it came out to $135 I enjoyed my time here. Food was fantastic, and specifically enjoyed the fact that they served us each meal (plated us individually at the table). It was a more intimate/personal meal. I wished the portions were a bit larger. But overall great experience, I'd definitely come again

We had a delicious meal at Darbar last week. We had a weekday dinner for 4. We were seated immediately near the bar and started going over the rather large menu. We had 2 vegans and 2 non vegans in our group and all left satisfied.We had the vegetable samosas and the Manchurian cauliflower for appetizers. Samosa were spot on. The cauliflower was good but the sauce was too sweet. We had the chicken tikka masala and another chicken dish. They were both well seasoned, fresh and tasty. The vegans had an eggplant dish and yellow dal. The dal was good but the eggplant was fantastic. I almost preferred it to my chicken dish. The portions were just right. We finished off our plates, shared a bit, but we were just perfectly topped off. Service was interesting. Our waiter was fantastic. Friendly, patient and he entertained my brother's chatting (he just returned from Delhi and had a million comments.) the other servers were rushed, somewhat dismissive and not too friendly. We sat downstairs near the entrance. We smelled a pervasive cigarette smoke smell throughout our meal. Never figured out where it comes from but we definitely smelled it and it was annoying. Overall, we had a great meal. Location was somewhat hidden on a cross street but it was just busy enough. It was an enjoyable experience.
This restaurant is delicious and the service was excellent. By far the best Indian restaurant in the area.

This was a fabulous restaurant. The food was absolutely delicious, the service was great and we enjoyed eating Indian food so much and this was fantastic. We recommend the stuffed bread with cauliflower, the mulligatawny soup, salag al paneer and the raita. I also sent delicious crispy bread with you to yummy sauces. Great place to go to!!
Don't waste your time, they made me feel like I was wasting theirs! Received the worst stares and the most unwelcoming greeting when I walked in.
I really enjoyed the food. Even my daughter who eats nothing enjoyed her chicken tikka. The spices were just right   Will definitely return my next ny trip

My friend and I had been wanting to check out an Indian buffet, and I picked this because it was a) open before noon and b) closest to my apartment in LIC. Add in the amazing food, good ambiance, and great service and you have a total win :D I made a reservation on Opentable for 11:30 AM (though we probably didn't need one) and proceeded to feast ourselves. The selection is incredible and the price is stunning - $20 for a tasty weekend buffet? Omg. They had the classics - naan, chicken tikka masala/butter chicken, saag paneer - but also a lot of interesting dishes - fish curry, goat curry, and a flan. Everything was fantastic. There is literally nothing to complain about - I had an awesome experience and got fresh, tasty food as soon as I sat down. I could only eat 1.5 plates, unfortunately, but I enjoyed every single bite. I would 100% come back :)
One of my favorite Indian restaurants in the city.  Love the butter chicken and naan.Love to pick up after work to surprise the family.

Please do yourself a favor, do not eat here at least their morning buffet. I am an Indian and I know when the quality of food is good or horrible. And this was horrible and definitely not at all worth $14.95. The food was spicy and tasteless. I don't know how is their a la carte as I have always been having lunch buffet in the past. It used to be favorite lunch place when I worked in a near by bank but that was 3-4 years back. Lately their buffet quality has gone down. Only thing I liked was their Naan bread. If that is what you want to have in buffet with maybe a mint chutney or raita or mango chutney then go ahead and spend 14.95 else you are better off enjoying the halal cart street food for $6 or some other Indian restaurants in the vicinity.

There's really nothing fine about this location. In my opinion, the food was average and the service was disgraceful. We waited a good twenty minutes before someone took our order. And twenty minutes to get water after asking. Everything was extremely slow to arrive and the venue just felt cheap. I noticed a lot of Indian families eating there so perhaps the food is pretty authentic. But the Indian family sitting next to us was treated like royalty: kept getting their beer glasses and water refilled while my mother and I just were ignored. Not cool. The food was average; certainly nothing to write home about, but decent. We shared the chicken tiki masala and lamb saag. I like spicy so it made me happy. They should have specified the spice levels or at least asked how much spice we wanted. But they never asked us how the food was or if we needed anything. I asked for the bill and that never came. I had to ask again and the server said "he didn't bring it because he thought we wanted to chat." Huh?  Yes we are chatting while we wait, but really I just want to get the beep outta here! Terrible customer service and waiters who clearly could not give a damn.A few years ago I was at the 55th street location. I remember the service and atmosphere there being much better there.
Food is delicious; staff is nice. Be forewarned, though--the curries are VERY spicy. I asked for mild spiciness, and I struggled to get through it.
This was a great dinner.  Wonderful service.Chris the manager was so attentive and pleasant.I had the lamb bhuna which was so delicious. I will definitely be returning.

This is now my favorite Indian restaurant in the city. My best friend and I were getting food to celebrate our first day of work and we stumbled on this gem on yelp. We got the free garlic naans with check-in, butter chicken, and chicken curry. The garlic naan was savory and flaky with the perfect amount of crisp. Both entrees were extremely filling and came with a generous side of rice. Highly recommend the butter chicken for a mouthwatering blend of buttery and tangy flavors.P.S. Viraj was an amazing server. Thank you so much for the complimentary dessert!

Viraj was amazing!!!  I came three times so far and I always ask for him.  I come each time from Atlanta with my Mom and wow the food is amazing, his service is amazing and he always recommends the best things!  I have traveled the world and this is definitely one of the BEST Indian restaurants in the world - not exaggerating - and I'm Indian myself!

My girlfriend and I took to Yelp to find a good Indian restaurant in our area. Exceptional. The ambiance upstairs was open featuring stained glass chandeliers and brick inlay walls; it was quite intimate. The lighting was also perfectly balanced, not too light or dark and we had plenty of space for ourselves. We started with an appetizer special, the Spinach moong chaat, that was balanced with sweet and spice. We ordered their Jaljeera Passion which was loaded with Tequila and Midori, slightly too sweet for my preference but excellent nonetheless. We ordered a second round without the midori. Also, happy hour until 8? Totes bomb. For our meals we ordered the Aloo Gobi and the Saag Paneer, which were by far the best cooked of each dish we've ever had. For $14 bucks nonetheless! The garlic naan is 100% a must for all diners. Totally fire. Overall we had a really great time, with exceptional service and a reasonable bill, which isn't the norm for the area. Totally exceptional.

Took my 12 year old brother to this establishment to introduce him to Indian cuisine, and he loved it (as did I). The ambiance was great and the decor was very sleek. We started with vegetable samosas, which were generously filled and delicious. He ordered the Tandoori Chicken and I got the Bombay Aloo witch a side of garlic naan for us to share. They served us family style and our table looked like it was meant for a family of four instead of just two siblings. The food was amazing and my brother informed me that he understands completely why I like Indian food and that he wants to come back to this restaurant soon. Our waiter and the staff were also extremely kind and made great small talk with us as they passed by or assisted with something involving our table. Excellent experience and I hope to come back soon.

I'm a fan of Indian food and I can say this is a really good place. Nice space, great food and prices. Best Naan I ever had. You should try the cheese and spinach Naan. We also ordered a Chana Masala and a Saag Paneer, which is the same as a Palak Paneer.  The paneer's texture was a bit harder than usual, but it was overall good (not the best I've tried). On the other hand, the Chana Masala is the best I've tried. One additional nice thing is that they already include the Birmani rice. Definitely a good option if you happen to be in New York and you love Indian food.

The first time I came to Dar Bar, I ordered the Butter Chicken Curry.  I was blown away by how delicious it was, and I ended up coming back with my girlfriend 2 more times in the same month.  I have eaten a lot of curry, but this place really does it right.  The portions are just right, and the service is smooth and quick. Moreover, on my second visit, the manager recognized me right away and welcomed me.  He brought me and my girlfriend to a seat where the lighting was romantic.  I have already recommended this place to many, and will continue to do so.

Food was good, but by default its on the spicier side. If you cannot handle spicy food, let them know ahead of time. Sometimes the waiters can be loud when talking to other customers, it would be nice if they quite down a bit given the ambience.

I come here all the time for their indian lunch buffet for $14.95I HAVEN'T FOUND ANOTHER PLACE THAT OFFERS SUCH A DEAL. I love filling my place with the typical indian classics such as tikki chicken masala and spinach paneer. Their naan is always served to you fresh too!

I went here because it was near my hotel and had decent reviews. That said, the Malai Kofta was probably the best I've ever had. I eat a lot of Indian food and have had a lot of Malai Kofta. If I lived here this would be a new regular place for me.

The delivery service is prompt when ordered with seamless. There is also a coupon available on seamless. The Beetroot Kofta is very unique and very delicious! It's a take on malai kofta where the kofta are made with shredded baked beetroots and the curry is lighter than many other places. Where many places use heavy cream, Darbar uses almond cream. This allows for a light yet not watered down curry. The garlic naan is basic just like any other Indian restaurant. Each entree comes with a side of rice, enough to feed two.

If you have an event coming up, small or large, do not think twice before booking Darbaar.  Mike (owner) was so accommodating to a last minute catering request at a venue 150 miles away from New York city.  He not only worked with me on the menu, offered his suggestions but also let me make my choices.  On the day of the event, given that it was an outdoor location, with no facilities or full kitchen, he and his team were incredibly creative and solution oriented.  Once they go to the venue, I did not have to worry about anything.  they handled everything with perfection.  I am a foodie and extremely particular about details, I could not have asked for any better.  Lastly do not cut corner and avoid getting the tandoor and tandooriya - my guests are still talking about the kababs and naan's - it was worth every bit.  Make sure to include this at your event.  my guests claim they have not had such authentic indian food even in india - so that goes to tell you the food is excellent!

Food was better than service or ambience. Although it wasn't terrible. Wish they clean the area better. Their white table cloth has stains, speaking of stains, was wearing white jeans found out later back of my thighs where I sat must've had residue of food, I've got two yellow spot that I hope I can get rid of.... food overall is good, service is okay but slow, ambience not so cool. It's just mediocre for the price they charge.

I've ordered the lamb korma for delivery at least 20 times - very consistent & delicious (my favorite lamb korma I've tasted in the he city!) they have an amazing lunch buffet for $15 with a lot of variety and delicious options. The atmosphere is nice inside, so is the service (I've dined-in numerous times too). Definitely give them a try!!!

I was initially pleasantly surprised by this place. The ambiance, service and food were all good. We were seated on the first floor on the same side as the bar. We went for a late dinner so we were one of very few parties on the first floor. As such, it was fairly quiet. Right before we finished our meal, during a pause in the conversation, both my partner and I heard the distinct, unmistakeable sound of squeaking coming from the corner of the room. He tried to make both of us feel better by saying that the squeaking we had heard was an air conditioner or something. But the next few minutes of prolonged squeaking made it clear that it was not in fact an air conditioner. When our waiter came by to clear our plates, we told him about the squeaking. We told him as an FYI because we assumed someone would want to take care of it. Unfortunately, not only was he completely unsurprised, he said "there's nothing scary back there" and then basically ignored us as we pushed him on it. He was not apologetic in the least. There was no acknowledgement by anyone in any managerial or supervisory role of our complaint. I will not be returning to this place.

Amazing Indian cuisine at a great price.Service was on point in here. There was some miscommunication with one of the items we had ordered and they were nice enough to send us the corrected dish.  Throughout the dinner the waiter kept asking if we were ok and checking up on us but not in the annoying way. Everything was delicious. I can't wait to come back.
Love this place the food is awesome the price is good $15 i always leave content. Its all you can eat till you are stuffed
Nice place to hangout around grand central, service was good and food too - I specially liked naan & yellow daal

Was staying at Hilton UN Millennium and this was close by. Excellent and very conscientious service. Favorite thing is the spice level is right on with a perfect amount of heat (I requested spicy). Chicken tikka masala was spot on and perfect for dipping with garlic naan; I also tried the Lamb Bhuma (listed as as a speciality) and like others found it enjoyable. They also have a great price fix menu for dinner that has all the major popular dishes which is what brought me back for more.

This is a really great and authentic Indian restaurant in Midtown! I've been here 3 times and each time has been amazing! I really like the tandoori chicken. The service is on point. Christopher has been our server each time and he always greets us with a smile. He is very attentive and friendly. This is great spot for a tasty relaxed dinner.

Great service and great food! My inlaws had never had Indian food before and this was a great setting for them to try it! All the food was authentic/fantastic and our server Christopher was wonderful and attentive! Best dining experience we've had in a while :)

Some of the best Indian food I've ever had. The naan alone is honestly to die for, the Tikka Masala was the perfect consistency and flavor, the chicken was tender, and the lamb house special we had (ghuna?) was also very good. I went twice in one week because I craved it after the first time I ate here. Go.

Beetroot Kofta was excellent! Would recommend to come just for that. The other food was tasty and that's coming from an Indian person. Beetroot Kofta + Tandori Roti would be a guilty pleasure. Service is also excellent. The owner was super friendly.

We tried the lunch buffet which was very impressive and high value for money. Great variety of veg and non veg food and taste was very close to what you would get back in India. Standout dishes would be the goat curry and chicken tikka masala and the fruit cream in desserts. Service was prompt and polite. A really good option if you are craving for Indian food in Manhattan.

this review is for delivery. great chicken tikka masala that hits the spot. it was the right amount of spicy but if you don't want it to be Im sure you could specify. I also like that the default basmati rice that comes with the entree contains peas. I ordered their samosas and veggie biryani and thought those were great and generous portion sizes too. On balance I think the food could be less salty but it hits my indian food craving perfectly.

Fantastic service. The owner was extremely accommodating. Two floors and spacious, so it'll be good for larger parties. (You should probably call in advance.) Pricing also decent. I recommend coming here for a special event, and you won't have to spend an arm and a leg for a good experience. I've been here twice, and I don't have a single negative thing to say about this restaurant.

First time at Darbar and had a great experience! The food was delicious-had the Chef's Special Chicken Malai-creamy and tender. The Gullb Jamun dessert was perfection! The service was exceptional and it was a pleasure to dine there.
Darbar has great Indian food. I highly recommend this restaurant, and you must try the lychee martinis!
Food fresh and well balanced taste. The only downside is the food odor tends to get in your clothes.
The food and service were excellent!!! Enjoyed everything .  Ask for Viraj from Goa, excellent service.
This is absolutely fantastic. Great food but exceptional service. I had such a great dinner. The ambiance was so pleasant. 100% recommend.

The relaxed "ease" of this place can't be overstated; along with its pleasant and uniformly helpful waitstaff (the manager's wit sets the tone). We went for a late lunch, both had the $14.95 buffet, which had delicious and abundant choices (many of the more typical standbys, like Chicken Tikka Masala,  Tandoori Chicken--not overspicy--Goat Curry, Goanese Fish Curry, several excellent Dals, all the usual chutneys, lime pickle, raita, salad, etc) that were replenished almost sooner than necessary. Yes, I realize that the food and ambience may not be of a "princely" level--but then, neither are most of us!PS: Forgot to mention the excellent, warm-from-oven naan that's brought to the tablle--another high point!

Excellent service. Food was excellent as well. I love Indian food and I'm choosy when heading out for a curry. Yelp reviews rated this highly and this place deserves it! Quiet and intimate so great for a date and chatting.
This is a great, friendly spot for excellent food!  The staff and service were excellent and the paneer was some of the best I've had!

I actually loooooved their lunch buffet. Came here on a snow day with my bf and we both liked how many curry options there were. My advice is to come a little earlier, because we came for the last hour of the buffet and it looked like we had arrived to Christmas Dinner after all the 10 nephews and nieces had already eaten. That being said, it was still good and all of the food was extremely tasty. I've tried maybe 6 Indian restaurants in the city now and this is probably my second favorite one, after Drunken Monkey in UES.
Delicious kheer and chicken Malai. Very good food and very good service. My server was Rana he explained the different entrees and what the curried were made from, very nice and helpful staff.

The service was very friendly and charming to us when we dined. The curry's we ordered had great depth of flavour and really good colour in sauce. Our entree plates (NOT the dishes themselves) were not pre warmed is the only criticism we can think of! Very pleasant time and tasty food!

I wouldn't exactly categorize this place as fine dining . They are expensive like a fine dining place though . Why I wouldn't categorize them as such are :-1) Ambiance - looks sorta like a buffet and definitely not a looker 2) Dirty dishes( preset glasses on tables )3) Average service ( Maybe because I came 45 minutes before closing but no excuses !)Their lamb saag was really good though . Their vindaloo wasn't too shabby either . At 20 dollars an entree though I am likely to just eat elsewhere that's a lot more economical and nicer looking ...
Great food and service. They were getting ready to close but everyone was very accommodating!
This is a great restaurant.  The food is wonderful and the service is outstanding. A very nice experience that I highly recommend.

In the interests of full disclosure, I checked in and got a free order of naan- chewy and perfect with the meal. Started with mulligatawny which was a moderately spicy and smooth purée. With added pappadums and chutney this was a good start. I had lamb saag which though good lacked a bit in the tenderness and flavor of the lamb chunks. Full disclosure: they also brought rice dessert which was flavored with saffron an a bit less sweet( in a good way) than I have had. Would recommend.
Food here is delicious and authentic.  All servers are super friendly.  If you want to have taste for Indian food while visiting NYC, come to this place and you won't regret it.

One cannot find a more delicious Indian lunch buffet in midtown. Quick, hot and delicious and it varies a bit day to day. We also had a department dinner there and the service was impeccable and the food was perfect. Can't say enough about the professional staff and how they operate the establishment. Don't miss this hit when dining in the area.

Great selection of Indian food on their menu.  Service was fantastic but wasn't completely sure if it was because we mentioned we just came from a Yelp party.  The waiter also spooned rice and the entrees onto our plate, which didn't seem to happen for other guests.  Food came out pretty fast and was delicious.  For dessert, rice pudding was nicely plated with crushed pistachios at the edge of the plate.  It had a good texture without being too creamy.  I'd come back if in the mood for Indian and in the area.

This restaurant was delicious!!! All of the food was so flavorful and there were so many vegetarian options!! The samosas were spicy but yummy and the Chana masala was AMAZING!! Naan bread was well worth it too. Not only was the food good, but the staff was amazing too! Everyone was very accommodating and attentive. I would definitely return next time I want some Indian food!!

Service was top tier. Food was delicious. Ideal to share entrees and try as much as you can. The tandoori shrimp was prepared to perfection, a must try. Please give this place a try. I was quite impressed.

Was looking for a nice romantic place to have dinner with my wife and this was perfect.  Great service, classy dining area, really good food.  It's a little pricey, but no surprise there, this is a nice place not a hole in the wall.  Will come back when we visit NYC again.

Went here for a quick lunch with my husband. We had the $15 lunch buffet, and compared to other restaurants they don't have much selection. Food is average, and they skimped on paneer on one of their paneer dishes. Their were too much peppers and literally 1 piece of a cubed paneer left. However the place itself is nice and clean.
One of the best Indian restaurants @ NYHouse specialty chicken malai and lamb are fabulous!Don't miss is! Cheers

We came here for dinner and was struck by the warm greeting and excellent service immediately.  Our waiter was extremely attentive.  We checked in on yelp and received a free order of naan...yes!  The food was excellent, and we were very satisfied and full afterwards.  The place was relatively quiet that night, but that was fine by us.  The only reason I didn't give the restaurant 5 stars is because their prices went up from what's listed on yelp, so expect to pay more (chicken tikka masala is $18, not &15).

I came here for dinner with a group of 5 other people. Our server was amazing and extremely accommodating. He gave me a suggestion for my entree and offered to replace It for free if I did not like it. He even brought us a complimentary dessert at the end of our meal. Everything was delicious and the ambience is great. I'd definitely recommend this restaurant
Great food. Caring service. Have lived next door for years but just discovered. Will definitely return !
Nice place. Good food and very good service. I got a recommendation for chef's special that was worth having.

First time trying Darbar with my team and manager for their Lunch Buffet Special $14.95 per person. It was pretty packed downstairs so the hostess seated the 7 of us at a table with our own little corner. One of my colleagues didn't get the buffet but he ordered the Tandoori Salmon Tikka from the dinner menu. He specifically told the server that he wanted the salmon plain with no spices. Unfortunately, the portion size was small and way too many spices coated on the salmon...I didn't get a picture btw! My colleague mentioned the salmon was dried and way too spicy for his palate so he had the staff take the plate away. I feel bad that we were all enjoying our plates from the buffet.I did like a few dishes such as Mixed Pakora (reminds me of Popcorn Chicken because of the deep fried battered), Basmati Rice with peas, Chicken Tikka Masala (my go-to), goat curry (needs a bit more seasoning), Paneer (Ooo yummy love that they fried the cheese and tossed into this sauce), and Kadai (peas and broccoli). Ooo we got two baskets of Naan bread...I do love bread! Man the food left me in a major food coma #itismode!Holy moly soda was $3 a glass...they should include beverages in the buffet special with unlimited refills...just saying you know. At first, the server charged my colleague $22 for his salmon but my colleague told the server to minus the salmon because he really didn't enjoy it which was nice of them. Actually, I noticed that Darbar is on the same block as my other two favorites Udon West and Joy Curry.

I've been here for dinner a la Carte and brunch buffet and definitely recommend the dinner - the selections of entrees are great and the portions are huge - love their curries and their dessert is delectable! The mango mousse is a great infusion of classic and new and the service is upstanding :)

Not bullshitting.....! Great food and great service. Try the chicken korma for dinner and come in for happy hour wine. Servers were nice too. Highly recommend to anyone in the area looking for bomb ass Indian food. It's authentic as they get
finally tried this place and glad I did.

I wouldn't order from or go to this place ever again. I placed a delivery order with them, and they delivered it to the wrong address. I called up and the guy didn't care and was completely unprofessional. He refused to admit they somehow put the wrong address on the item even though the address I entered was 100% correct. He said, "what do you want me to do?" and ended with a ridiculous, "we'll make sure to deliver to the perfect address next time." Like delivering to an address "pretty close" was somehow good enough.Anyway, I'd stay away from here. Terrible customer service and so many other better Indian places in the area.
A nice find. Good food at good prices in a nice quiet environment. We had the Chicken Korma, Chicken Tikka Masala and the Chicken Tikka. Excellent Naan.  We definitely plan on coming back.

Sat upstairs in a long narrow room.  Welcomed by a friendly professional waitstaffThe food is delicious and perfectly seasonedPappadam was the best we've had in a long timeNice wine listChanna masala spicy and oh so goodAloo gobi with perfectly cooked cauliflowerWish the vegetables were more varied and generous in the delicious korma saucePerfect raita and rotiWill certainly return. Highly recommend

The naan that comes with the lunch buffet is to die for.  The lunch buffet was great, with a variety of meat and vegetarian choices.  There was even a fish curry.  The food was fresh, and there was plenty of paneer in the paneer dish.  I was able to eat and pay quickly.

I was back again in NYC and didn't miss a chance to visit my favorite Indian restaurant in NYC - Darbar. I love this place not just for their food, but how well they take care of me. Just tonight, I ate a wonderful new dish, the chicken mirch bhuna - it was so good. And now finishing dinner with a wonderful Kheer!

Only downside is the price but everything else was great.  We ordered take out: Lamb Biryani, Chicken Vindaloo w/rice, garlic naan, pickle, kheer (rice pudding), and papadum for a total of $68. The meal was spicy and tasty.

Very good food. Waiter was attentive and accommodating. Ordered the meat appetizer and the samosa was so good. Then ordered chicken korma and split a salt lassi. Never had one before but it was good. Onion naan.
This is probably my favourite Indian restaurant in New York. Great presentation, service and flavors. Bar has a great selection of  cocktails. Highly recommend dining here.

We definitely enjoyed our late lunch. The buffet was good, but it could have been better stocked (perhaps because it was so late?).  I loved the chai, but it seems that a $4.50 cup of tea should come with at least one free refill. The naan was delicious--hot, light, and fantastic. The service was slow initially but picked up toward the end of our meal.

This restaurant serves the best Indian food in New York City. I went to this restaurant by chance and was so impressed by the quality and taste of Indian cuisine. Species were well balanced and fresh. The bar serves great cocktails as well. mango lassi is refreshing. My fav appetizers at Darbar are crunchy okra, chicken tandoori and chicken samosa. I recommend this restaurant to anyone wanting good food in New York City.

This was a great little find after a long day of walking the city. Easy to reserve through Yelp. Christopher was our waiter, and he took good care to suggest food that was delicious, plentiful for our family of five, and considerate of a food allergy. They even brought a tasty Indian pudding for us to try at the end of our dinner, despite our having turned down the dessert menu (we were happily stuffed)! It was a comfortable atmosphere, not too loud, and had nice, clean bathrooms! I would highly recommend, and if I lived in NYC, I would be a regular. I will let my friends who are vacationing in NYC know about this little gem.

On our last night in New York, we decided to take a chance on this place. We are so glad we did!! Amazing food and amazing staff. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars: you would not believe the review. But it is worth every penny.

Amazing Indian food restaurant! I loved the food (basically tasted like a Hyderabadi restaurant), and the service was excellent - polite and quick. The owner was nice enough to offer us complimentary kheer (a kind of rice pudding) at the end of the meal :)Definitely recommend this, and I'll certainly come back here
Wow! Delicious food, cozy and thoughtful setting, fantastic service! I would love to try everything on the menu. The beetroot malai kofta was flavorful and filling. I wish I left room for dessert.
Really really good indian food!! the service is excellent as well, very friendly and caring!I would totally recommend going there

Manek (Mike) is an extraordinary host. Very kind and made our experience unforgettable. Food was delicious. We ordered the butter chicken and chicken vindaloo. Garlic naan was fluffy and warm. The food was savory. We ordered samosas as appetizers. Definitely recommend for dinner. Happy hour specials are a plus! Everything half off. Food and service did not disappoint! Thanks Manek!!!
Great experience! Tasty and quick, and they gave us both free naan (with the Yelp check in) and free dessert! We really enjoyed our experience here and will be coming back for sure.

One of the best Indian places in NYC. My regular goto for over three years. I order from here all the time on seamless, and dine in as well. So my review is not based on a one off experience but a consistent experience over years. Food is great- simple, flavorful, wonderful. And consistent every time. Every item on the menu is so good. And don't miss the dessert... Especially the kheer and rasmalai!But what really makes the place stand apart from other Indian restaurants is the service. No stuffy unfriendly wait staff, no endless waiting to get your food, no begging around to get someone to clear your table etc. Besides the owner and manager here are always walking around checking on customers and actually following up on any requests.On the whole, highly recommended!

Great and friendly service. The food (Tikka Masala and naan) was fantastic, just the right portion. They even gave me rice and dessert on the house! The server, Boss  definitely lived up to his name. The amount of food and the price I paid for was a huge bargain! Nothing to complain nor criticize about.

Darbar is absolutely delicious!! The staff was so friendly, attentive, and helpful. The food is outstanding!!! Perfectly seasoned, authentic, spicy without being overwhelming, and quite fresh. I loved that they had unique things on the menu like salmon tikka masala (try it!! it's heavenly) and these onion fritter-like things that are similar to vegetable pakora, but are even better. From someone who eats Indian food ~6x/month, this was some of the best Indian food I've ever had! Thank you :)

Good Indian food and good for large groups. Usually not a fan of buffets but I like how they run their buffet for lunch. Wait staff is hospitable and the food is delicious. Not the cheapest Indian I've had but reasonably priced. I enjoyed my experience and because it's close to work, I'll return soon.
This is my new favorite Indian spot in the city. It doesn't get any more authentic than this. The butter chicken is amazing and the service is on point.

Nice atmosphere and a comprehensive menu with some unique authentic dishes. The food was delicious! I am a vegetarian and was very satisfied. Beetroot dumplings were wonderful and I've never seen them anywhere else! The naan was soft with a good bake. Highly recommend for a nice dinner out.

When you have Murray Hill's curry hill just a subway/bus/uber away, Darbar's food really falls short. The lunch buffet is pricier, and less fresh- my friend and I came right when it opened and it looked like the lettuce had been left out for days. The variety of food is average - butter chicken, goat curry, spinach paneer, etc. Taste also was pretty average. My recommendation - don't come for the lunch buffet.
The Lamb was amazing. And we asked for more naan just to eat with the sauce. Nice place and delicious.
Very hospitable Good for large groups Food was very niceThey gave us a complementary dessert at the end of the meal.

This was my first time ever having Indian food in my life and honestly, upon walking in I was skeptical. Not because of the atmosphere but taste. The restaurant was beautiful, super clean, an overall very fine decor. We were seated at a table and our waiter still offered us the happy hour bar prices which was super nice. I had a couple glasses of red wine which were so decadent and full bodied. I loved it. My friend had the white which he couldn't get enough of. We started off with the chicken 65 which was so good that I honestly could have licked the plate clean. Then for dinner he had the chicken masala and i had the butter chicken, to which we both added spice. BAD IDEA (But it was so damn good). I'm a heat fanatic so I was sure this would be right up my alley but they sure humbled me completely. The food was extremely tasty and I enjoyed my meal but nice time I'll be sure to add absolutely no spice to my meal lol overall it was an amazing experience and I will definitely be back! Also, the Naan was to die for, so fresh, so warm, so crispy

By far the best Indian food I've ever eaten in my life. I already love Indian food and I am a huge foodie. I cook myself and I love developing flavors. One of the reasons I love Indian food. This place is on point. Their flavor palette is so sophisticated I'm beyond impressed.
Excellent Indian food in midtown. The service was excellent and the food was great! I got the vindallo which is my favorite Indian dish. Perfectly spiced! Highly recommended.
Nothing worth writing home about. Went for lunch buffet - chole paneer and chicken tikka masala were sweet, daal was pretty great. Gets the job done for the price (15/person).

Walked in through stars; they looked at our stroller and just walked. No support offered. Very Humane Ordered chai and asked if it is refill; told yes and when asked for refill told that it was a mistake so sorry. Very courageous. Price of non refill chai is $4.Paratha of $6 with no pickle or Yoghurt. Very Indian as we eat parathas without yoghurt (dhai)Buffet servicing, I did not chose, was so bad presentation that I would not recommend as looks unhygienic. 6 yr old buffet was full priced Parathas good Beet root malai kofta good tooMissing Indianness in service else won't mind paying the money they charged.Would strongly recommend only To-Go and never dine in
Fabulous every single time and every single bite !! Our "go-to" place for a lovely delicious dinner and the wait staff is wonderful!! Don't miss it!

Came here for lunch on a Friday afternoon, and they were able to accommodate my group of 8 without a reservation. The interior is classy, warm and well decorated. We decided to try the lunch buffet because they had close to 8-10 different entrees (including several vegetarian entrees,) rice, naan and 2 desserts for $15/person. The food was good, not the best Indian I've ever had not definitely not the worst. Service was good but not over bearing. The waiters set you up w water and come by to refill it, and then you're basically on your own with grabbing food. Food:Paneer Pasanda - great flavor, right amount of spice, could be a thicker gravy though.Palak Channa - could use more spice, but fresh Mango mousse- amazing! Light, sweet and tasted just like a thick mango lassi Sooji Ka halwa- a porridge like dessert made from a grain. Surprisingly good, great texture and not too sweetMy friends loved the meat entrees, especially the chicken tikka masala and the goat curry!

All I can say is AMAZING! Service is spectacular, listen to their recommendations! You will not regret it! Food is flavorful, tasty and delicious! This time we went during Happy Hour, sitting at the bar, (which goes until 8pm btw) and the wine just kept coming! This is definitely my go to place for Indian Food. Everyone needs to hit up this spot and enjoy! Their house specialities are to die for and their Naan is yummy!

We were celebrating a family birthday. Service was great and they did a wonderful job with the dessert. Food was excellent. Great sauces. Goat curry was a hit. Try the rosemary naan for a change up. Rice pudding too.
I ordered chicken Biryani for takeout and they sent me small chicken cubes with little rice. I don't know what it was but not at all Chicken Biryani!

We hosted a lunch party and catered our food from Darbar. Manek (Mike) was extremely responsive and worked with us to achieve a balance between our budget and the dishes we wanted. We had people who loved spicy and some who couldn't tolerate spice, vegetarians and non-vegetarians, and Manek's recommendations were spot-on. After the walkthrough at the venue, we discussed exactly what needed to be rented and what his staff would bring, and I was so glad to have a caterer who valued attention to detail as much I do. On the day, the staff arrived on time and set up promptly. They were very polite, attentive and very efficient. They are clearly experienced and provided wonderful service. The food was excellent and all my guests were very pleased. The beetroot malai kofta and veg samosas were a hit with everyone. From our non-veg menu, the chicken lajawab, seekh kabab, and reshmi kabab were outstanding.

Stopped by today for the lunch buffet.It's okay.Not great.They are slow to replace items that are low or basically empty.Service is fundamentally non-existent. The naan is okay, but far from remarkable.And, charging for iced tea by the glass is a bit much.Nothing to recommend here, and nothing to compel me to return.
One of the most authentic Indian restaurants in NYC. Food quality is nice and very much Indian taste and flavor
Great staff, great food!  I highly recommend this place, you will be glad you came here.

This is one of my favorite spots.  The food is always delicious and the staff are so nice and friendly - they make you feel like family, which I love.  Here's a little secret:  this is a great spot for happy hour.

I went to Darbar last night and had a fantastic meal as well as a fantastic experience. I had initially ordered take-out, but at the last minute I decided to dine-in and the staff was more than accommodating and swiftly placed my meal in their dishes. The waiters were also extremely polite and offered to serve the first portion, which I found endearing. I had the chef's beetroot special, which had a nice soft texture and tasty sauce to pair with my rice and naan. Overall, great intimate vibe, great Indian food. If I lived in NY I would definitely be coming back for more.

This place never fails in satisfying customers! The food is healthy, cooked with less oil and not greasy as with usual Indian restaurants. Service is always top notch! It was warm upstairs and I requested them to make it cooler which they obliged right away. I have been coming here for over 15 years and it is certainly my favorite Indian restaurant in this area!!

This country mouse died and went to Indian heaven! The vegetable samosas were the best I've ever had. The pastry was perfection and the chutney delicious. I have an adventurous palate when it comes to Indian food but I chose the butter chicken because I was in the mood for creamy tomato spicy noms. It had just enough heat to be sexy and the spices were a subtle glide on the tongue, riding along the creamy rich sauce. The rice was sweet and fragrant with hints of orange rind..oh my. The Naan was excellent and I used it to mop up every last drop of the sauce.  They have an extensive menu and a lovely libations menu. I was tempted by some of the creative cocktail creations but ended up ordering a crispy Pinot Grigio. I finished off my meal with some rice pudding  which once again was superbly spiced with lovely hints of cardamom and orange rind.  The service was impeccable. The waitstaff was attentive but not obtrusive.  I could tell that they try their best to give first class service and to meet the needs of their guests. Our waiter noticed that I fanned myself with my napkin and he asked if I was too warm. He set up a pillar fan and directed it at our table. I was appreciative. I also appreciated their attention to our water glasses.  When our rice bowl was empty someone immediately appeared to see if we wanted more. They truly anticipated our needs which made for a pleasurable dining experience!

Food was very good but the whole experience was spoilt by the huge gratuity added after tax. 35 dollars for max 10 mins of actually serving food. And the food came before they cleared the starters and the dinner wasn't cleared before the bill arrived shame made a food Indian and a reasonable bill unreasonable

We expected a bit more after seeing all of the great reviews.  It's a simple, good Indian spot.  Zero ambiance, fair to mid-level service.  The food is solid - very good Indian, but nothing to write home about.  They did have a great bottle of wine (amidst a really bad wine list) that we splurged on, which made the meal very nice. They had a bit of a hard time accommodating a dairy allergy - even the rice had cream in it!
I live I. Atlanta with a ton of great Indian restaurants but Darbar is my go to in the big Apple!  Doesn't get much better than this for Indian.  Sweat and flavor score of 5!

Awesome place to get some solid Indian food! My friend and I were craving Indian so we set out to find a good spot for dinner in Murray (Curry) Hill. Darbar did not disappoint! We both checked in on Yelp for the free naan bread, and I asked the waiter if it applied for garlic naan. Initially he said no, but when our food came out he brought us a garlic naan anyway! So nice of him!! I love garlic!I ordered the Chicken La Jawab, and my friend got the Chicken Mirch Bhuna. The La Jawab was well spiced and very tasty. Mirch Bhuna was a bit spicy but not too overwhelming--might get that one for myself next time, as I felt the La Jawab needed more of a kick! Portions were perfect--with the two naans plus the entrees and the rice that came with the entrees, we were nicely stuffed afterward but not feeling like we'd explode. Ended up paying $26 each person with tax and tip included, which is not bad for a lovely dinner!Overall, it was such a satisfying meal and I'd happily come here again the next time a craving rolls around!

The food was really good! I think the Gravies were slightly watered down but the flavors were good. I really liked the chicken tikka masala - it was great! Have the naan with the sauce - amazing! The service is really amazing - everyone is so nice and welcoming. The lunch buffets is $14.95 and there is a ton of options to choose from. It's a nice place to come by to for lunch.
Tried their Goat Sukha, Goat Vindaloo and Baigan Bharta (Eggplant). Everything was good, service was great and overall a nice experience.
LOVE the lunch! They will contact if they don't have what u ordered. Very delicious goat curry! Lentil soup was creamy and mild touch of coconut and delicious!Also, always great time happy hour.
Really good food! Watch your check though, they thought we were tourists and purposely tried to charge us for and extra meal, our tab was $43 higher than it should be. Just saying....

One of the best Indian restaurants I've been to in a long time! The food was superb, the service outstanding. Prices are very reasonable for the east side of midtown Manhattan, especially given the quality. For the adventurous, pair your meal with the only Indian Shiraz I've ever seen - it's a perfect complement to the spice profile of their signature dish "Bhuda" (try it with shrimp!); a spicy, traditional Indian dish with a tomato base and lots of tender garlic, ginger and onions that will knock your socks off!!  My hubby got Vindaloo, which was WAY too spicy for me but exactly what he wanted, lol!  We both loved we ordered, which is rare (usually one off is has food envy).  For dessert, we had what is definitely the ONLY Kheer (rice pudding) that left me wanting to lick the bowl, lol!  We only wish we could transport this place home with me, so we could try more dishes!
The service and the food was amazing. I came with a big group of girls and we enjoyed ourselves very much. We will definitely come back. 100% recommended.
Awesome food!  Reasonably priced.  Full bar.  Chicken Madras is my go to, but branched out this time with Chicken Mirch Bhuna.  It was hot to go!!!

We came for dinner on a Thursday night and the food was delicious. Our waiter, Christopher, was one of the best I've had in a while and continued to check in on us throughout the evening. I would definitely come back to this spot in Midtown East.

Excellent service and carefully prepared dishes. Ambiance rather bland and would be helped by more art on the largely bare walls. Be careful about the spice levels if this matters to you. Some dishes are marked with one or more chilli peppers, leading me to believe that dishes with no such marks would be mild. Neither was. Husband's house special shrimp and my mango chicken were both uncomfortably hot for us. But then the waiter stepped in, whisked away both dishes and brought them back much milder.   Rice with mushrooms and peas and naan bread completed our meal. At the time of this writing, one naan was complementary with a Yelp check-in, and a delicious dessert of rice pudding with almonds (more than enough for two) was another freebie.

A quick late dinner midweek. Excellent service, the chili paneer really lit things up - spicy spicy hot but still with excellent flavor. The chicken tikka masala was standard fare, good but not great, and the only reason the review might not have been five stars. The garlic na'an was perfect (somehow that's something a lot of places mess up) and likewise the saffron rice.  Kheer for dessert was rich in flavor and perfectly made. All in all, pretty close to perfect!  A recommended midtown resource!

I was picking up my take away order earlier this week and they were kind enough to honor a Yelp deal that was only redeemable for dine in! Thanks!!!Anyway, Darbar has been my go to restaurant for Indian food since my wife and I moved into the city. They have two locations here in Midtown and both never fail to please. The food is always flavorful with the perfect amount of spice. Some of my favorite dishes include the Baingan Bhartha, Chicken Vindaloo and Chicken Bhuna.  Just delicious and you can't go wrong!

Great meal here with my family of four around 8:30 on a Wednesday. Seated immediately. Started with Pappadum and then enjoyed several dishes family style. Chicken Tikka Masala, Tandoori Chicken, Aloo Gobi and Garlic Shrimp Curry. It came with rice and garlic naan. The naan was amazing! However, the first naan (we also ordered a second) was supposed to be free with a check-in with Yelp and they agreed but then went ahead and charged us for it. Didn't feel like arguing about five bucks, so I didn't. They were very friendly and helpful with what to order. Only complaint was we had to keep asking for water refills. Other than that it was a really great meal. Would definitely go back if we lived here.
Had lunch with a group of 10 and were seated promptly without reservations at noon. The food was delicious and you will not be disappointed.

They have the best naan I've ever had!!!! So I showed the waiter my check in on yelp to get a free naan and asked him if I could get a garlic naan and he told us that free naan for only the plain one. I had no problem with it BUT when he brought the food, he gave us a beautiful GARLIC NAAN!!! That was extremely nice!!! The naan was really delicious, the texture was similar to a pizza crust but thin, chewy and crispy. We got one butter chicken and one chicken mirch bhuna. They were both good. I love that they used dark meat to make the butter chicken, the sauce was creamy and slightly sweet. But I prefer the sauce in chicken mirch bhuda because it's spicy but not too much that you still can enjoy everything else. The rice came with the curry was great too.Service was nice, the waiter always filled up our water. I would definitely come back here again to try more food.
My favorite Indian restaurant in NYC. And I've been to many. The Mulligatawny soup is to die for.  Service is quick and polite. Quiet. What's not to like?

The best Indian food I've had in years and I'm a picky devil when it comes to good Indian food.  If you find yourself in East midtown hankering for Indian THIS is the place you need to go.   We started with the tandoori vegetables as an appetizer.  It was amazing.   Mid meal I had to order some naan to ensure that my sweetheart and I did not pick up the plates and lick them.  We were promptly delivered a basket with piping hot garlic naan that melted in our mouths and made sure got every last drop of the sauce off the plates.   We ordered the Chana Masala and the Chicken Mirch (one of their house specialties).   Both were delicious.  Oh, one more thing:  the standard rice that came with our dishes was so lovely, I could have noshed on that plain, as it was.   I highly recommend.
I am new to NY and wanted some good Indian food. The happy hour was amazing, the chicken tikka masala was delicious, and the service was fantastic!!
Very good food and an excellent atmosphere. The staff was very nice and accommodating. This is just the type of place we needed after being surrounded by the clatter of New York.

We really enjoyed the food and friendly service. I had butter chick which was almost as good as home made by my Indian friend. The rice was so perfectly cooked. It was almost like it melted yet it was cooked soft and not mushy. My favorite thing was the garlic naan.

I'm usually apprehensive about trying new restaurants because they tend to not meet any of the hype someone else gave it. However, I have to say that Darbar exceeded my expectations. From the levels of exotically delicious Indian flavor in the dishes to the cheesy garlic naan, this restaurant followed through. I highly recommend it.

My daughter and I came here for lunch the other day and enjoyed our meal very much. The buffet didn't look all that appetizing, so we opted to order from the menu.  We ordered the Aloo Gobi Masala, Chicken Saagwala, Garlic Naan, and rice. Plenty of food and even brought home some to snack on later.

For the most part it's usually very good. I go here often. But today at lunch I'm pretty sure the cooks didn't wash the Bhagi cooked with Aloo very well because of the grainy sandy stuff in it. Yeah, pretty bad. But besides that one dish, had no issues. I've been here many times before and all the dishes were good. Staff is friendly. Good place to have conversation over lunch or dinner.

This was really delicious Indian food in NYC! We ordered for pick up through Yelp and it was done super fast. We tried the beet root malai kofta, roti and bhindi masala - all were delicious! Next time will have to try eating there as it looked really nice inside and an appetizer too, but the portions were really large and perfect for leftovers.Yay for quick and delicious Indian food to go!

The buffet is worth every damn cent. I went there twice in 5 days. The butter chicken and mango custurd was the best! They even have fish and goat curry , tandoori chicken too!Veggie options were very good too! Gobi Manchurian, channa masala, daal, veg gravy all were good. Oh and the palak panner too :) Ensure you ask for whole wheat bread - it's much better than naan!I'll definitely go there again someday :)

My husband and I hired Darbar to cater our wedding, and we could not have been happier!  We wanted a delicious dinner buffet, passed hours d'ourves at cocktail hour, and bar staff for 140 people.  Some guests had dietary restrictions, ranging from vegan to kosher-lite (no mixing of meat&dairy, etc.), and Darbar's team was amazing at accommodating us.We were a little nervous about how our guests would react to Indian food.  It's our favorite, but neither we nor our families are Indian, and some of them come from less adventurous gastronomical backgrounds.  We had no need to worry.  Everyone loved it!  We received so many compliments on the food, and of course, we loved it too.  Our wedding was very DIY, at a warehouse venue with no kitchen (sink only).  Darbar handled all our flatware and silverware rentals and did a great job setting up and breaking everything down quickly and professionally.  The lack of a kitchen did not daunt their catering team at all.  Did I mention the food was great?  It was great!!

This is my 3rd time here. So far every time I've been here the staff is super friendly and helpful. The food is also amazing. From the soup to the entre everything is well spiced and full of flavor. I'm a big fan of the prefix menu that they have. Every time I've gotten something different, but my fav dishes are the reshmi kebab and the chicken tika masala. The flavored naans and kulcha are also amazing. The mint chutney is fresh and full of flavor. As far as cocktails go I've tried almost everything on the menu and I recommend either the mango mojito or the mango margarita. Overall one of the best values you can get in NYC.

Came here for dinner on  a Saturday night around 8pm. It wasn't packed at all. We were immediately seated at a table.The ambiance of the restaurant was very elegant and laid back.The service was great and I have to say the food was pretty good as well.For the meal we ordered Garlic naan, plain naan, paneer pasanda and channa masala along with some white rice.The food took a bit of a while to cook. From the time we placed the order to the time we actually got the food was about 28 minutes however we did get papad and chutney while we waited for our meal to come out.I had ordered the food to be medium in level of spice however the food was actually pretty spicy . I am able to handle the level of spice however my boyfriend not so much. I felt pretty bad that this food was a lot more spicier than it should have been for a medium. The waiter was nice enough and he gave him some yogurt to add into the food to make it a little less spicy.I had also ordered my naan with very little butter as I am not a big fan of butter and they were really great in honoring that. Most places look at me crazy but I was happy that they honored it without asking any questions. Minus that little mishap the food was great, the service was great. I will be going back here again when I get a chance.Just a tip for those of you who can't handle spice- order with the level of spice at a low because the medium was amazing for me but for someone who can't handle spice- the medium will burn your mouth.:) But I love my spice so I will be back .,. Great place great food.

This is a tough one to write, probably because I know a great deal about Indian cuisine and how it should taste.  I eat Indian at least 3 times a week and have dined in some of the finest Indian restaurants in the USA and the world.We came here tonight for an early dinner.  The folks working here were incredibly kind, the service a solid 5 stars.  We had a lovely table near the bar that was very comfortable, perfect place to catch up with an old friend.  Hence - ambiance and service gets 5 stars.Started off with Bhel Puri and a plate with Pakora/Samosa.  The Bhel Puri was good, 4 star good at best.  The Pakora/Samosa veggie platter was 3 star at best.  It needed some help.  The portion size was huge for the money at least.The grilled garlic shrimp my dinner partner ordered were awful.  They were overcooked, dried out and chewy.  If this was not my best friend in the world I would have sent the dish back.  No excuse for this.The Baigan Bharta (eggplant) was 3 star.  It was overcooked and lacked proper seasoning.  I was hungry so I ate some; however,  if an Indian national familiar with this dish were present they would have sent it back.  The mixed pickle (lime achar) was amazing, some of the best I ever had.  This was a lovely surprise.  the rice was quite good as was a bean dish that came out?  Not sure if we ordered it?Prices were decent as we had several cocktails.  Again, servers and ambiance  was just lovely.  So yes, I shall return.  However, next time I will be careful about my food choices.
Great food and great service. The chefs special chicken malai is very much worth going out of your way for.

The service and food here was fantastic! :) The chef special was so good! I'm going back on the website and I believe I got Chicken Mirch Bhuna (House Specialty). The flavors in my dish really just hit the spot. My friend got the Chicken Tikka Masala which was also great! I would recommend this restaurant to anyone and I can't wait to go back.
The food and service was excellent. It was a friend's birthday, I tried to hide and surprise her with a cake. The waiter was nice and was able to help me and surprise her.

Came here for a quick lunch with a friend during the weekday. For $16 this is a solid lunch spot with a friend. The buffet is quick and efficient-no need to wait for your food to be cooked! The naan basket comes out hot and fresh which was great. Overall, if you want a sit down meal for good Indian food during lunch, this is a great option :)
Always fresh and delicious. Best vegetable samosas in town (for about 4$) and quick and friendly service. Definitely my favorite Indian spot in midtown.
One of the few really nice indian restaurants in midtown. I've been here many times and all their dishes are really delicious

Great Happy Hour Spot! This was a great spot for friends to HH and catch up since it's not very loud/crowded. Happy Hour specials were great and go until 8pm. They also have great options to snack on (garlic cheesy nan was delicious!). Would also recommend the mango smoothie, which you can add vodka to. Will definitely be back to happy hour and/or dinner!

I'm legit pausing Real Housewives of Beverly Hills (aaaaand you stop reading) during a heated scene to write this review. After thorough perusal (I was thinking the word was perusion so thanks autocorrect) of the Indian options in my area for delivery, I settled on darbar. (Grill? The other one? Enigmatic identities if you ask me) Holy smokes. Ordered the Chana saag. Delivery estimate was 45 min. Because I'm sure my neighbs have had enough of me blasting the same edm over and over the last week, I spared them and used headphones this evening. I only had to one-ear-on-one-ear-off briefly bc right on cue 45 min later, the dude arrived. I had tons of shit that I wanted to finish before dinner and I was procrastinating so by the time I chowed down it was luke warm at best. But Holy Smokes (note the upper case for emphasis) it was bomb AF anyway. Flavors were out of control. I asked for medium spice level which I feel like is usually pretty sweat-inducing for white people but this was not spicy enough for me and I had to add sriracha. I also despise onions and could kinda perceive the essence of the dreaded and repulsive (imo) onion crunch but this was so delish, I'm letting it slide. What really put me over the edge was the fucking RICE. The fucking RICE is flavorful!!!!!! I could eat the whole fucking container of that shit PLAIN. (UPDATE: I just did). The rice bumped this shit from 4 to 5 stars. The portions are also really big. I barely ate today so my stomach is probably more shrively than normal with less capacity but still, I'm struggle-city trying to finish it. Do yourself a favor and eat here.

This place is perfect for a date night or a night out with girlfriends. I got the chicken tikka masala but my friend got the chef special and it was really amazing, I will definitely be getting that next time! The naan was really fresh and delicious. We were also given a complimentary dessert. Great meal, I will definitely be coming back

This was my first time at any indian cuisine. therefore i am unable to compare anything. The food itself was great. i liked my mango smootie. We didnt order much but we were both stuffed! The staffs were very well mannered and attentive, lots of smiles and also asked us how our food went when we are not chewing. great job on that! the restaurant look tidy and clean. only reason why i didnt give a full 5 stars is because we had special treatment for writing a potiential review on yelp. i felt they shouldnt have to do that for a review. politely ask for a review ONCE is okay. it gets weird after a couple of time and with a complimentary dish. A yelper would have honestly rate them on service and quality without it.other than that, i would recommend you to go test it out yourself, check in for 15% off a dish they have at discount. otherwise, hide your identity and see how you would rate them. happy yelping!

If you are in the city and looking for a delicious Indian restaurant you should definitely make it here. I have ate here a few times and consistently receive great food and service. I travel a lot and try Indian in many places with dissatisfaction but never here. You won't be disappointed!!

The buffet is limited. I would have loved to try more things. Check it out before sitting at a table. The staff wasn't friendly, we didn't even get a goodbye, thanks or anything. The tandoori chicken was very good though.
Incredible lunch buffet.  Not to spicy.  Great service.  Perfect lunch spot.  Basmati rice was the best I've ever had. Finished up with Indian balls served in honey  warm syrup.

I'm not too surprised that I'm a fan of this place.  After all, Chola is my favorite Indian restaurant in the city and it seems they are run by the same folks.  The food here has always been consistently good at both of their locations.  The one feels a bit less fancy than the other one a few blocks north but is still a comfortable place to dine.  Their lunch buffet is solid and I've never had any issues with the flavor or quality of their food.  The spread is always solid and the chicken marsala, tandoori chicken and fish curry are among my favorites.  I also love the fact they serve pani puri as part of their lunch spread, which is always a nice treat for me.If you're looking for a place that serves a better-than-average selection of lunch buffet items for a reasonable price, this is a great pick.  It also helps that the service is solid and folks here are pretty friendly.

We went late in the day for their lunch buffet. On one hand, it had not been 'refreshed' in a while. They ran out of Tandoori chicken and apparently had no interest in rectifying the situation. And yet. The flavors were unusually deep, complex, and satisfying. We've enjoyed several lunch buffets on the UES. The consensus, though, is that this one wins. We'll be back, but it'll be no later than 12:30.
